text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
BeProblem 0..*ElementA record of a problem
identifier 0..1IdentifierThe business identifier(s) for the problem entry
dateTime 0..1dateTimeThe dateTime when the problem has been recorded
reporter 0..1Reference(BePractitioner)The professional that recorded the problem
clinicalStatus 0..1codeThe clinical status of the problem - whether it is active, resolved...
Binding: ConditionClinicalStatusCodes (required)
status 1..1codeThe status of this problem record entry
Binding: ConditionVerificationStatus (required)
subject 1..1Reference(BePatient)The person that has/had the addiction
problemCategory 0..1CodeableConceptThe category for the problem - diagnosis, risk, etc.
Binding: https://www.hl7belgium.org/fhir/CodeSystem/be-vs-problem-category (required)
origin 0..1BackboneElementHow the problem came to be recorded
type 0..1CodeableConceptA coded type of the problem record origin
Binding: https://www.hl7belgium.org/fhir/ValueSet/be-vs-condition-origin-type (required)
reference 0..1Reference(BePractitioner)
problemCode 0..1CodeableConceptBinding: https://www.hl7belgium.org/fhir/CodeSystem/be-vs-congenital-anomalies (required)
started 0..1Period
resolved 0..1Period
bodySite 0..1BackboneElement
site 0..1CodeableConceptBinding: Body Site (required)
laterality 0..1CodeableConceptBinding: Laterality (required)
note 0..1AttachmentAdditional notes for the problem.

Documentation for this format

name: BeProblem
description: This is the logical model of the patient's problem entries in a record.

element.short: A record of a problem
element.definition: A record of a problem - a risk, a condition, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: The business identifier(s) for the problem entry
element.definition: The business identifier(s) for the problem entry - This is an optional attribute, used for example to track an entry throughout its lifecycle, or across vaults.

element.short: The dateTime when the problem has been recorded
element.definition: The date and/or time when the problem has been recorded in any system.

element.short: The professional that recorded the problem
element.definition: The professional that recorded the problem.

element.short: The clinical status of the problem - whether it is active, resolved...
element.definition: The clinical status of the problem - whether it is active, resolved...

element.short: The status of this problem record entry
element.definition: The status of the problem record entry - whether it is active, entered in error, etc.

element.short: The person that has/had the addiction
element.definition: The patient

element.short: The category for the problem - diagnosis, risk, etc.
element.definition: Supporting reason for status information.

element.short: How the problem came to be recorded
element.definition: How the problem came to be recorded - in a consult, etc.

element.short: A coded type of the problem record origin
element.definition: A coded type of the problem record origin

element.short: Additional notes for the problem.
element.definition: Additional notes for the problem
